citeinfo.title: Zion National Park General Management Plan (Year 2000)

descript.abstract: This is an Arc/Info coverage consisting of 25 polygons representing currently proposed Research Natural Areas (RNAs) in Zion National Park, Utah. These RNAs are part of the Zion National Park General Management Plan (GMP), which are also referred to as the Visitor Management and Resource Protection Plan (VMRPP), and which designates 7 administrative zones to be managed appropriately. RNAs are specific areas of land to be used for the sole purpose of education and research. They have been selected and designated based on various criteria, and based on information gathered and analyzed from wildlife, vegetation, demographic, historic, and cultural databases.
descript.purpose: This coverage provides the proposed Research Natural Areas (RNAs) for Zion National Park. An RNA is an administrative designation that federal land management agencies use to set aside field ecological areas for research and education, and to maintain biological diversity.
descript.supplinf: The emphasis of an RNA is on conducting baseline inventories and long-term ecological observations, with the primary purpose of creating an ecological/environmental benchmark over time. RNAs are not open to public recreational use, but may be open for educational uses. RNAs are located in areas with little to no human disturbance. Eventually these RNAs will be used for the sole purpose of education and research and will be kept untouched and unused by the visiting public. This allows researchers to study vegetation, wildlife, habitat, history, trends, patterns, etc. minus the 'human impact' element which can bias results or cause interference with controlled studies. This coverage was created by selecting RNA polygons from the zion_gmp coverage. Please refer to the metadata for zion_gmp for detail on how the administrative zones, including RNAs, were developed.

citeinfo.title: General Management Plan for Zion National Park, Utah

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.4.0.1911

attracc.attraccr: All attributes have been qualitatively checked and verified in ArcEdit using multiple background images and coverages. This coverage contains the standard Arc/Info default attributes and three user-defined items.

dataqual.logic: This dataset was processed following Zion National Park, GIS Program Standards. These standards verify that every dataset created in, imported to, and exported from the park adheres to certain processing standards that are FGDC compliant. This coverage has been checked for duplicate label points, missing label points, sliver and gap polygons, dangling arcs and undershot arcs.
dataqual.complete: This dataset is considered to be 100% complete for its current intended purpose.

horizpa.horizpar: Accuracy is tested by visual and measured comparisons of DOQs, GPS features, and other source data geospatial datasets.

citeinfo.title: Zion National Park General Management Plan (Year 2000)

srcinfo.srccontr: RNA polygons were selected directly from the source coverage and put into the coverage zion_rna. Summer 2002 this coverage was projected to NAD83; certain polygons (see 'comments' field in rna.pat) were adjusted to match 1999 True Color Aerial Photography.

procstep.procdesc:
The Arc/Info RESELECT command was used in ArcEdit to select polygons from the GMP coverage, based on the ZONE attribute. Polygons with ZONE value of 6 (indicating RNA) were put into the new coverage, zion_rna, using the PUT and GET commands in ArcEdit. See zion_gmp metadata for further detail on how these polygons were originally created in that dataset.
This GIS layer was projected to NPS Datum standard NAD83 using ArcInfo 8.1 on Sun Solaris; certain polygons were on-screen shifted to 1999 True Color Aerial Photography in ArcEdit session. This coverage was also clipped with the updated boundary for Zion National Park which was edited and created after the original RNA Datum NAD27 coverage.

cntorgp.cntorg: Zion National Park, National Park Service

cntinfo.hours: 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Monday Through Friday

overview.eaover: The first five items are the Arc/Info default items which are internally tracked and assigned by Arc/Info software. There are three user-defined items which have been added to the dataset. ZONE is a numeric integer representing the GMP management zone; all are 6 for Research Natural Area. ACRES = the number of acres of each individual polygon. Arc/Info automatically calculates polygon areas in square meters as the default. This number was multiplied by .0002471054 to obtain the figure for acres. NAME: a text field listing the name of the Research Natural Area. COMMENT = text field to track edits to the NAD83 version.
overview.eadetcit: Contact ESRI (Environmental Systems Research, Inc.) on the World Wide Web at http://www.esri.com for a more detailed explanation of their internal file structure. Contact Zion's GIS program for further detail on the user-defined items.
overview.dsoverv: This dataset consists of 25 polygons representing the Research Natural Areas of Zion National Park.

distinfo.distliab: The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics ("GIF" format files) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data. The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data be directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources, which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
